noun.description: The state, fact, quality, or condition of being singular.
examples: he believed in the singularity of all cultures

noun.description: A point at which a function takes an infinite value, especially in space-time when matter is infinitely dense, as at the center of a black hole.
A hypothetical moment in time when artificial intelligence and other technologies have become so advanced that humanity undergoes a dramatic and irreversible change.
examples: maybe the singularity just happened, and we didn't notice

origin: Middle English: from Old French singularite, from late Latin singularitas, from singularis alone (of its kind) (see singular).
